page.title: 08Westland Helicopters Yeovil.
page.content: Westlands,one of Europe's leading helicopter firms & employing about 5500 people, is also a leader in automated machine control.Helicopters at present being built are the Sea King ,the Lynx (Army & Navy versions), the W 30 (a 17/22 seat civil airbus), & the EH 101 (due to fly in Dec '86). The company is in something of a crisis at present.An expected order of 27 for the W 30 from the Indian Govt,did not materialise following the assassination of Mrs Ghandi. Financial difficulties have followed with a take over bid being made & withdrawn, & share prices down. The Company Chairman has resigned & been replaced,and a complete review of all activities is being undertaken by top accountants Price Waterhouse.The workforce,(& Yeovil),is nervous with rumours of perhaps 2000 redundancies.
